column4: Hey, I got a problem with setting up the nvidia driver on my ubuntu. I just installed it and all, and it reupdated the xorg.conf file as it "should" be. Problem is when Is when i restarted my system GDM wouldn't start because the X server wasn"t properly configured(that's what it said) so it disables the x server and askes me to start gdm when i have configured the xorg.conf correctly. So what I did was that i overwrited the xorg.conf file wi
th my backup file so I could start gdm. Question is, um. How do I fix this?
Anyone got any ideas?
how did you install it? via nvidia's package?
Yeah
The installation and all went fine, only problem was that it didn't find any kernal what so ever. so It had to make one
I'm not really good at ubuntu, just started with it
hmmm, no errors during build?
nope, no errors

it asked me if i wanted to update the xorg.conf file and I said yes. When I then restarted the system it said that the xorg.conf file wasn't properly configured and the x server disabled. Please restart gdm when you have properly configured xorg.conf
you still there? did you get my private messages?
didn't get it
have you tried the nvidia-glx package in the repos?
I havent tried them yet
it's not the latest drivers, but they work pretty well (I am using them myself)
How do I remove the current driver I've allrdy installed though?
are you using feisty? or an earlier version
feisty I guess?
check out http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Ubuntu:Feisty#How_to_setup_nvidia_drivers_in_7.04
I'll try that
thanks
